posts.name: Elaine
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.93 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • Help keep important information easily accessible with pinned messages. Your most frequently asked questions, dinner reservations, and vacation itineraries are already top of mind. Now they can be top of chat as well.

Backups is now available in production as well as TestFlight, but your early feedback is still crucial for us as we roll this out to a broader audience.

Please continue to report any issues you encounter!

When reporting issues, please include debug logs and screenshots if applicable; if you’re experiencing a crash, please also include .ips files. Instructions can be found here.

Thank you all, as always, for helping us improve Signal!

link_counts.title: Pin a message to top of chat
Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.92 release
Pin a message to top of chat

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.93.0.1310-beta

67 new commits since 7.92.0.1306-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.93 [1]

  • Filter out 'Self' from custom story distribution lists [2]

  • Remove unused DispatchMainThreadSafeObjc function [3]

  • Fix 4xx download error handling (and clean up) [4]

  • Remove unused NSCopying conformances [5]

  • Use longer timeout for PUT /v2/keys [6]

  • Basic UI for member tags in the various places they are needed [7]

  • More judiciously set BackupPlan and side-effects on during restore, from SS [8]

  • Bring back removed Backup attachment fetch optimization [9]

  • Don’t re-encode images repeatedly [10]

  • Clean up Swift TSOutgoingMessage subclasses [11]

  • Swiftify TSOutgoingDeleteMessage [12]

  • Swiftify DisappearingMessagesConfigurationMessage [13]

  • Swiftify OWSProfileKeyMessage [14]

  • Refactor Backups attachment-fetch optimization [15]

  • Remove unused arg to asBackupFilePointer [16]

  • Remove support for serializing outgoing SKDMs [17]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.86.12 [18]

  • Use Dismiss instead of Cancel when sending via the Share Extension [19]

  • Return error earlier when CDN info is missing [20]

  • Move rawContentType to ContentTypeRaw.init [21]

  • Use UInt64 for download limit remote configs [22]

  • Remove throws from methods that can’t throw [23]

  • Downgrade expected error to warning [24]

  • Swiftify OWSOutgoingSenderKeyDistributionMessage [25]

  • Adjust enforced attachment size limits [26]

  • Add support for DNG [27]

  • Consolidate code for parsing CdnInfo [28]

  • Fix string typo [29]

  • Fix incorrect animations in chat input bar in certain scenarios. [30]

  • Use dynamic colors for table headers and footers [31]

  • Liquid Glass contact note sheet [32]

  • Remove AppUpgradeNag [33]

  • Avoid redundant disk space checks in Backup Attachment Downloads [34]

  • Show download progress bar for link-n-sync/fre tier backup restore. [35]

  • Don't show pinned messages when previewing a cvc [36]

  • Long profile name in story reaction gets truncated [37]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.86.13 [38]

  • Disable chat bar when expired/not registered [39]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.62.0 [40]

  • Swiftify OWSBlockedPhoneNumbersMessage [41]

  • Member label flag to dev [42]

  • Member Label view controller UI [43]

  • Swiftify OWSSyncConfigurationMessage [44]

  • Swiftify OWSSyncFetchLatestMessage [45]

  • Remove throws from method that doesn't throw [46]

  • Pass attachment size limit to HEAD requests [47]

  • When displaying a contact name, also display the profile name [48]

  • Fix pinned messages editing behavior [49]

  • Resurrect batched delivery receipt processing [50]

  • Increase the batch size for delivery receipts [51]

  • Swiftify OWSSyncKeysMessage [52]

  • Swiftify OWSSyncRequestMessage [53]

  • Remove extra background around reminders on iPad in dark mode [54]

  • Fix incorrect background color for "Empty Filtered Chats" panel. [55]

  • Add debug log viewer before submitting call quality survey [56]

  • Swiftify OWSSyncMessageRequestResponseMessage [57]

  • Swiftify OWSReadReceiptsForLinkedDevicesMessage [58]

  • enable pinned message send [59]

  • Connect member label text field to preview [60]

  • Don't present survey over a different chat [61]

  • Swiftify OWSViewedReceiptsForLinkedDevicesMessage [62]

  • Clean up StreamTransform comments [63]

  • don't show add member in ContactAboutSheet unless its local user [64]

  • Update release notes [65]

  • Update translations [66]

  • Enable call quality survey [67]

updates-bot:

67 new commits since 7.92.0.1306-beta

This one is for the kids who like that 6-7 meme

posts.name: Chloe
posts.cooked:
Long text messages can escape the bounds of the screen in the pinned messages view. The censored message above the uncensored message is a link with no embed.

IMG_44571284×2778 171 KB

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.93.0/0d397db9f4a31d1953a63de608728ece83ab34c84d42afcdede3d855be9e60de.zip

If a user selects multiple images using the photos option in the add attachment menu, and then taps the send button more than once in rapid succession before the screen is dismissed, multiple messages containing the same media will be sent. This does not happen if a video is attached to the message.

link_counts.title: Pin a message to top of chat

posts.cooked: This post was flagged by the community and is temporarily hidden.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Please provide a screenshot and a debug log.

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
Hey all!
Sometimes archived chats stay archived on my phone on Signal, even when a new message comes in, here’s my theory why:

  1. I archive a chat on Signal Desktop.
  2. A new message from someone gets send to me.
  3. I open Signal on my phone.
  4. The message gets loaded and the chat displayed an unread message. AFTER this, Signal on my phone receives the command, that on desktop this chat got archived. So it moves immediately to the archived chats.

Once or twice I saw this happen: I open the app on my phone and a chat appears at the top after a new message comes in, then it disappeared into the archive. Other times I didn’t even notice a new message was there, because no visual movement took place.

Phone: https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.93.0/085e79382ff4478ef0d35fdf0d9fd52e2166091677d2e9a5f83b4015a3082127.zip
Desktop: https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.87.0-beta.2/0ab4f673f88a6a0858bffb4684cc4795fbf6d4dc3c88df70c20402df14093e06.gz

posts.name: Elaine
posts.cooked:

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
No, I have this turned off.
I always archive chats (which are not “in use”) to keep it clean. This worked well for some years now.

posts.name: Jacek K
posts.cooked:
I swiped on the message to see details and then swiped back, and this happened

IMG_51141179×2556 116 KB

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.93.0/42685eaba4058686466f0c188f77075a6fc933fc7ef80c65e5d4b80aed400524.zip

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.94 release.
